newsitem.title: DUBAI: Enron eyes India as market for Qatar gas.
newsitem.headline: Enron eyes India as market for Qatar gas.

text.p: Enron Development Corp president Joseph Sutton said he was optimistic that plans to ship Qatari liquefied natural gas to Israel would stay on track, but added that India was also an important for the project.
"We've been working with the Qataris on marketing gas to India primarily and then to Israel and Jordan," Sutton said in answer to a question at an infrastructure conference in Dubai.
"Our hope would be to sell a train to India and send one to Israel and Jordan. We would like to split our customer base," he said.
But he added it was possible that Indian demand could absorb much of the exports from the $4 billion planned project in Qatar.
"We are encouraged by the Indian projects, particularly the project in Gujarat. It is always possible that India could take some of gas (intended to go to Israel)," he said.

Enron has been in talks with Qatar to launch the Gulf Arab state's third LNG project and still has a heads of agreement in place with Doha despite losing in September an exclusivity supply arrangement with the Israeli government for LNG.
The U.S. company is building a $2.8 billion power plant in the western Indian port of Dabhol, where it needs at least two million tonnes of gas a year.
